content:
You're on a roll! Combining sales with coupons and cashback apps is a great way to maximize your savings. Finding the best deals and sales at stores like Kroger requires some planning and strategy. Here are some tips to help you do just that:

**1. Check the weekly ad:** Kroger releases a weekly ad that outlines the sales and promotions for the upcoming week. You can find the ad on their website, mobile app, or in-store.

**2. Use online deal sites and forums:** Websites like Slickdeals, Hip2Save, and CouponMom provide aggregated lists of sales and deals for various stores, including Kroger. You can also find online forums and Facebook groups dedicated to Kroger shopping and couponing.

**3. Sign up for Kroger's loyalty program:** Kroger's loyalty program, Plus Card, offers exclusive discounts, fuel points, and digital coupons. You can also load digital coupons to your card and receive personalized offers.

**4. Look for sales cycles:** Many items at Kroger go on sale in cycles, typically every 4-6 weeks. Keep track of prices and wait for your favorite items to go on sale.

**5. Stack sales with coupons:** Combine manufacturer coupons with sales to maximize your savings. Check the coupon policy at Kroger to ensure you understand what's allowed.

**6. Use cashback apps:** Apps like Ibotta, Fetch Rewards, and Checkout 51 offer cashback on certain items at Kroger. Use these apps in conjunction with sales and coupons for even more savings.

**7. Shop during sales periods:** Plan your shopping trips during sales periods, especially for non-perishable items. Stock up when prices are low to save for future use.

**8. Check for price matches:** Kroger offers a price match guarantee. If you find an item cheaper at a competitor's store, Kroger will match the price.

**9. Use digital coupons:** Kroger offers digital coupons that can be loaded to your Plus Card. These coupons are usually exclusive to loyalty program members and can be combined with manufacturer coupons.

**10. Shop in bulk:** Purchasing items in bulk can be cost-effective, especially for non-perishable items. Just be sure to check the price per unit to ensure you're getting the best deal.

**11. Use store brands:** Kroger's store brands, such as Simple Truth and Private Selection, are often cheaper than name-brand products and are of similar quality.

**12. Avoid shopping when you're hungry:** Shopping for groceries on a full stomach can help you avoid impulse purchases and stick to your shopping list.

By following these tips, you'll be well on your way to finding the best deals and sales at Kroger and maximizing your savings. Happy shopping!
